root.speaker: Priya
root.text: Hey! Are you going to Professor Martin's office hours? I heard if you go twice, she remembers your name. That's basically a letter of rec.

choices.text: Oh absolutely. Strategic face-time. I've got my questions pre-written.
choices.internal_monologue: (Two people bonding over calculated sincerity. This is college friendship at its finest.)

choices.text: I was actually just gonna study at the library. Wanna come?
choices.internal_monologue: (Priya seems surprised you suggested something that isn't résumé-motivated. She says yes immediately. There's a whole person in there under the LinkedIn profile.)

choices.text: Can't, I need to prep for the career fair. Next time?
choices.internal_monologue: (Priya nods. She understood 'next time' perfectly. It's the same 'next time' you used on Sam. You're getting very good at this word.)

priya_office_hours.speaker: Priya
priya_office_hours.text: Oh good, I ranked my questions by 'most likely to seem insightful.' ...Is that normal? That's normal, right?

choices.internal_monologue: (You are both describing sociopathy and calling it 'being proactive.' The system rewards this.)

choices.text: Priya... do you ever just like, genuinely want to learn something? Without the strategy?
choices.internal_monologue: (She goes quiet for a second. Then: 'Sometimes I forget what that feels like.' This is the most honest thing either of you has said in weeks.)

priya_library.speaker: Priya
priya_library.text: This is nice. Just... studying. No angle. When's the last time we did something without calculating the ROI?

choices.internal_monologue: (You can't. That should alarm you more than it does.)

choices.text: Well technically the ROI on studying is a higher GPA, so...
choices.internal_monologue: (Priya laughs, but it's the kind of laugh that's also a sigh.)

priya_honest.speaker: Priya
priya_honest.text: My parents mortgaged their house for this. Literally. I can't just... enjoy things. Everything has to lead somewhere.

choices.text: I get it. I really do.
choices.internal_monologue: (You do get it. The weight of other people's sacrifice turns every choice into a transaction. Priya's eyes are a little red. Neither of you mentions it.)

choices.text: Then let's make THIS lead somewhere. Study group every Tuesday?
choices.internal_monologue: (Even your kindness has a structure. Priya notices. Priya doesn't mind. Priya is you in a different font.)
